critique: This document is an executive order from Franklin D. Roosevelt approving a Code of Fair Competition for the Country Grain Elevator Industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act. It reflects a strong interventionist approach to the economy, typical of the New Deal era. The order itself doesn't directly address immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. It centralizes power in the federal government through economic regulation. The executive power is expanded as the president approves the code. Therefore, the initial scores are as follows:
